result.execSummary:
The defendant Keshawn R. Grayson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 1 day presentence credit should supervision be revoked

miscConds.notes: Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent
Shall have no contact or communication with the victim or victim's minor child

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
(15CM411 & 15CM482) Defendant Keshawn R. Grayson in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens and reviews def's rights; no contest plea is entered to 15CM411 and counts 1, 3 & 4 of 15CM482; Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty and all remaining counts are dismissed and read in; parties heard; defendant makes statement; Court heard and sentence is imposed:

15CM482
cnt 1:

90 days DCJ w/h&t consec - imposed & stayed w/29 days presentence credit
2 yr p&p
no contact with victim or victim's minor child
any counseling as directed
DNA sample
costs

15CM411 & 
15CM482 counts 3 & 4:

w/h
2 yr p&p
no contact w/vicitm or victim's minor child
any counseling as directed
costs

15CM411 shall receive 1 day presentence credit

Called 15CM411 and 15CM482. Defendant Keshawn R. Grayson in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Shelton heard on argument for motion to modify bond/bail, requests signature bond or at very most $200 cash. Ct. heard, finds victim rights compliance. Atty Barrington heard on argument, oppossed to any modification at this time. Atty Shelton heard. Ct. heard, will keep cash bail as previously set. Discussion held regarding the return date.  Return date rescheduled for January 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Return date at 01-20-2016 02:30 pm.
Jury trial at 02-24-2016 08:30 am.

Jail call on 15CM482 - State also wanted JT removed in 15CM411: Defendant Keshawn R. Grayson in court, in custody with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (jail only).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Atty. Button notes that address is 913 N. Spring Street, Beaver Dam, WI, Atty. Button also notes that his name is spelled without the "y" in it; State heard on bond, $2,500 Cash bail w/conditions; State now requests JT removed in 15CM411 so Def. can find attorney for both; Court finds probable cause. RD 1/4/16 at 2:3pm & JT 2/3/16 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets $2,500.00 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with AMM, dob 11/20/88 or her residence at 531 Walnut Street, or contact with her minor child;   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Court orders JT removed in 15CM411 and track with this case (per request from State)
Defendant, Keshawn R. Grayson in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to plead not guilty. Discussion held. Court leaves on JT calendar.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, AMM, dob 11/28/88 or her residence.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at 531 Walnut Street, Beaver Dam, WI.

(12:50) Defendant Keyshawn R. Grayson in court, in custody with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (jail only).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. stands mute; Court enters NG plea on behalf; Atty. Button notes that Def.'s name is Keshawn (no "y"); State moves to amend same; Court so orders; Court finds probable cause. RD 11/23/15 at 3:30pm & JT 12/16/15 at 8:30am in Br. 1; Court sets $500.00 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, AMM, dob 11/28/88 or residence at 531 Walnut, Beaver Dam, WI.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
